titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Marshall Green papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-30T14:13-0800

change.item: Added links for materials on digitalcollections.hoover.org
Declassified records subseries added for 2015 July release
Declassified records subseries added for 2015 May release
Declassified records subseries added for 2013 release

did.abstract: The Marshall Green papers consist of speeches and writings, correspondence, dispatches, memoranda, reports, studies, and printed matter relating to American foreign policy in East Asia, especially with regard to China, Korea, and Japan; American foreign relations with Indonesia and Australia; the Vietnam War; and international population problems and American governmental population policy. They originate from Green's official assignments with the State Department, extensive professional travels, and role in discussions of global population issues. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

As required by law, folders of security-classified materials have been removed from the collection until they can be declassified by government officials. Upon declassification, the materials are available in the Declassified U.S. Government Records series listed at the end of the collection.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marshall Green papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2002.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Marshall Green papers consist of speeches and writings, correspondence, dispatches, memoranda, reports, studies, and printed matter relating to American foreign policy in East Asia, especially with regard to China, Korea, and Japan; American foreign relations with Indonesia and Australia; the Vietnam War; and international population problems and American governmental population policy. They originate from Green's official assignments with the State Department, extensive professional travels, and role in discussions of global population issues.

Letters between Henry Kissinger and Green in the Correspondence series shed light on President Richard Nixon's trip to Asia, resumption of talks with China, and the Vietnam settlement. However, the bulk of the materials in this collection can be found in the Office File. They relate to countries and regions in which Green served--their history and the impact of their government policies on the United States. This series also includes materials relating to President Nixon's trip to China and his communications with Green about Asia between 1969 and 1972. Green's speeches in Australia, as well as his speeches relating to population affairs, especially immigration and refugee issues, are also included in this series.

Green's travel reports, submitted primarily to the State Department, though one on China was directed to President Nixon, are included in the Travel File. They record his general observations on the political, economic, and social scene in Asia and Africa, its effects on population growth, and the status of family planning programs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: Biographical File, Correspondence, Speeches and Writings, Office File, Travel File, Subject File, Computer Disk, Photographs, and Declassified U.S. Government Records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings and printed matter, "humor" file, letters of commendation and thanks, naval service file, and records of awards and honors, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes charts, clippings and printed matter, correspondence, poems, and speeches and writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assignment to Ready or Standby Reserve, 1953 January 1, and letter of resignation and honorable discharge, 1955 October 24.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, conference papers, drafts of writings, letters to the editor, notes, statements, and testimony, arranged chronologically. Additional speeches are included in the Office File.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1 print depicting Marshall Green sitting in a room and 1 print depicting Green along with Bruce Johnston and Bill Schulz inspecting the model of a generating plant during his visit to the Latrobe Valley in the State of Victoria, Australia, undated.
4 prints depicting Marshall Green with President Sukarno and 1 print depicting a group of unidentified people gathered in an open area, undated.
1 print depicting Green with an unidentified individual, 1983 January.
1 print depicting Green accompanied by Paul Wolfowitz shaking hands with President Suharto, 1988 February 10.
2 prints depicting Green and members of the Other Club, Holyoke, Massachusetts, 1992 October 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The records relate to Laos, Taiwan, Queensland, and population matters in Egypt and Pakistan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Most of the records relate to the Special Refugee Advisory Panel (SRAP), Laos, and Indonesia. Other topics include Korea and the negotiating volumes in the trial of Ellsberg and Russo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memorandum from Walter S. Robertson (Assistant Secretary of State for Far Eastern Affairs) to the Secretary of State (John Foster Dulles), subject "Recommended Action to Meet the Taiwan Straits Issue."
More legible version of this memorandum can be found on the State Department's website: https://history.state.gov/historicaldocuments/frus1958-60v19/d38 (accessed 28 July 2015).
